thread.title: Former Hong Kong chief to face misconduct charges
thread.title_full: Former Hong Kong chief to face misconduct charges | afr.com

author: Jasmine Wang
title: Former Hong Kong chief to face misconduct charges
text:
An investigation into Mr Tsang's use of yachts and jets owned by businessmen started in the last four months of his six-year tenure. Ng Han Guan by Jasmine Wang Donald Tsang, who completed his tenure as Hong Kong's No. 1 official in 2012, is due to face charges of misconduct in public office Monday afternoon, the South China Morning Post reported.
An investigation into Mr Tsang's use of yachts and jets owned by businessmen started in the last four months of his six-year tenure. Mr Tsang, the city's second chief executive since its return to Chinese rule in 1997, apologised for "disappointing" the public during the probe.
Mr Tsang would be the highest-ranking public official in Hong Kong ever to be charged, according to the SCMP, and one of the highest in greater China. The newspaper didn't cite anybody in its report.
